titleStmt.title: The Compleat statesman demonstrated in the life, actions, and politicks of that great minister of state, Anthony, Earl of Shaftesbury : containing an account of his descent, his administration of affairs in the time of Oliver Cromwell, his unwearied endeavours to restore His Most Sacred Majesty, his zeal in prosecuting the horrid Popish Plot, several of his learned speeches during his being Ld. Chancellor, his two commitments to the Tower, the most material passages at his tryal, with many more considerable instances unto His Lordships going for Holland.
titleStmt.author: Dunton, John, 1659-1733.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Benjamin Alsop ... and Thomas Malthus ...,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to J. Dunton: cf. Lowndes, vol. 3, p. 2250.
Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
